content: These are the kind of articles that make die hard grantland readers loath The Ringer. I wonder if you’ve actually ever been to Levis stadium? If you have, then you’d know that the field isn’t turf and that it’s natural grass. If you’ve ever been you’d know it’s a beautiful stadium. If you’ve ever been you’d know that the stadium looks empty because people spend the majority of the game inside clubs or suites. I get that the stadium has its issues and I agree that it lacks some soul, but come on man. This article’s headline is an absolute joke and you know plenty of teams don’t play in their name sake cities. The Niners team is the problem, not the stadium. Next time you write a piece about a stadium, make sure you are allowed in the press box before you blast it off.
